data.title: Highlights from the O’Reilly Artificial Intelligence Conference in Beijing 2019
data.description: Experts explore the future of hiring, AI breakthroughs, embedded machine learning, and more.

data.title: Toward learned algorithms, data structures, and systems
data.description: Tim Kraska outlines ways to build learned algorithms and data structures to achieve “instance optimality” and unprecedented performance for a wide range of applications.

data.title: Designing computer hardware for artificial intelligence
data.description: Michael James examines the fundamental drivers of computer technology and surveys the landscape of AI hardware solutions.

data.title: AI and retail
data.description: Mikio Braun takes a look at Zalando and the retail industry to explore how AI is redefining the way ecommerce sites interact with customers.

data.title: Data orchestration for AI, big data, and cloud
data.description: Haoyuan Li offers an overview of a data orchestration layer that provides a unified data access and caching layer for single cloud, hybrid, and multicloud deployments.

data.title: Top AI breakthroughs you need to know
data.description: Abigail Hing Wen discusses some of the most exciting recent breakthroughs in AI and robotics.

data.title: AI and systems at RISELab
data.description: Ion Stoica outlines a few projects at the intersection of AI and systems that UC Berkeley's RISELab is developing.

data.title: The future of machine learning is tiny
data.description: Pete Warden digs into why embedded machine learning is so important, how to implement it on existing chips, and some of the new use cases it will unlock.

data.title: The future of hiring and the talent market with AI
data.description: Maria Zheng examines AI and its impact on people’s jobs, quality of work, and overall business outcomes.

data.title: Tools for machine learning development
data.description: The O'Reilly Data Show: Ben Lorica chats with Jeff Meyerson of Software Engineering Daily about data engineering, data architecture and infrastructure, and machine learning.

data.title: RISELab’s AutoPandas hints at automation tech that will change the nature of software development
data.description: Neural-backed generators are a promising step toward practical program synthesis.

data.title: How to become a truly data-driven organization
data.description: From basic BI to using AI to automate and augment human endeavors, data-driven systems are increasingly powerful and pervasive in the enterprise.

data.title: Iterative competition is a catalyst for better problem solving
data.description: Kaggle is more than a machine learning competition platform; it’s a facilitator for efficient problem solving and a community for sharing and learning.

data.title: One simple chart: Who is interested in Spark NLP?
data.description: As we close in on its two-year anniversary, Spark NLP is proving itself a viable option for enterprise use.

data.title: Get ready to retrain your organization for AI and ML
data.description: To successfully integrate AI and machine learning technologies, companies need to take a more holistic approach toward training their workforce.

data.title: Enabling end-to-end machine learning pipelines in real-world applications
data.description: The O’Reilly Data Show Podcast: Nick Pentreath on overcoming challenges in productionizing machine learning models.

data.title: What are model governance and model operations?
data.authors: Ben Lorica, Harish Doddi, David Talby
data.description: A look at the landscape of tools for building and deploying robust, production-ready machine learning models.

data.title: The quest for high-quality data
data.description: Machine learning solutions for data integration, cleaning, and data generation are beginning to emerge.

data.title: AI needs a training reboot
data.description: Artificial intelligence is harder than we think--we have a long way to go to reach anything like general AI.

data.title: AI is an opportunity to redefine entire ecosystems
data.description: Jeff Wong on choosing to embrace change rather than feeding the dialogue of fear.

data.title: Improved tools are fueling AI adoption
data.description: We now are in the implementation phase for AI technologies.

data.title: Maximizing paper clips
data.description: We won’t get the chance to worry about artificial general intelligence if we don’t deal with the problems we have in the present.

data.title: Bringing scalable real-time analytics to the enterprise
data.description: The O’Reilly Data Show Podcast: Dhruba Borthakur and Shruti Bhat on enabling interactive analytics and data applications against live data.

data.title: Applications of data science and machine learning in financial services
data.description: The O’Reilly Data Show Podcast: Jike Chong on the many exciting opportunities for data professionals in the U.S. and China.

data.title: Becoming an ML company means investing in foundational tech
data.description: Companies successfully adopt machine learning either by building on existing data products and services, or by modernizing existing models and algorithms.

data.title: AI, ML, and a better customer experience
data.description: From data quality to personalization, to customer acquisition and retention, and beyond, AI and ML will shape the customer experience of the future.

data.title: Real-time entity resolution made accessible
data.description: The O’Reilly Data Show Podcast: Jeff Jonas on the evolution of entity resolution technologies.

data.title: Rise of the (advertising) machines
data.description: Mike Tidmarsh looks at how data and AI are radically reshaping the world of marketing communications.

data.title: Privacy, identity, and autonomy in the age of big data and AI
data.description: Sandra Wachter argues that a right to reasonable inferences could protect against new forms of discrimination.

data.title: Sustaining ML in the enterprise
data.description: Drawing insights from recent surveys, Ben Lorica analyzes important trends in machine learning.
